FYI:
This may be a JRE problem -- I took a new Sun Java 2 SDK, SE v1.4.0_01 today as 
well, so I'm going to reinstall that and see if it fixes the problem.

No, this doesn't fix the problem.

Starting F3 with a new workspace (-data) seems to be working ok, but my old 
workspace will not start up.

Maybe I'll try running Eclipse with a different JRE.

Simple steps to re-produce:

- create Java project
- build 
- turn auto-build off
- shutdown
- restart
- Refactor -> rename
- shutdown
- restarting fails

As spec'd, session properties are copied from the source to the destination 
when doing a move.

Unfortuanatly the builder persistent info is stored as a session property and 
it has the name of the project in it. This value is not updated on a project 
move.

Recommended fix: The buildmanager gets a pre-delete notification when a 
project is being moved. We should clear out the builder persistent info from 
its session properties at this point. Note that the instantiated builders list 
is already cleared so this is not a performance hit. (we were always doing a 
full build anyways when you rename a project)

Have verified that this one-line fix fixes the problem.

Created regression test, which verifies the problem and the fix:

 - org.eclipse.core.tests.resources.session.TestBug20127

traces.message: Problems encountered starting up plug- in: "org.eclipse.core.resources".
